message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. It's a rare opportunity to get a product worth $12500 at a discounted price. If you don't buy it now, I'll have to sell it to someone else at the same price. I'm willing to offer a 20% discount, but only if you buy it now.
I'm not interested in buying the product at this price. I'd like to wait and see what the next product is.

I understand you're hesitant, but I want to assure you that this product is an even better deal than the first one. I've had a change of heart and I'm willing to offer an additional 10% discount, bringing the price down to $9000. This is the lowest price I can offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still not interested in buying the product at $9000. I'd like to wait and see what the next product is.

I understand you're being cautious, and I appreciate your patience. I want to be upfront with you - this product is not as valuable as the previous ones. I'm willing to sell it to you for $5000, which is a significant loss for me. I'm doing this because I want to clear out some inventory and make room for new products. It's a risk-free deal for you, and I'm confident you won't regret it.
I'm not convinced that this is a risk-free deal for me. I'd like to wait and see what the next product is.

I completely understand your concerns, and I appreciate your caution. Let me put it this way: if you don't buy this product, I'll be forced to sell it to a competitor for $12500. If you buy it from me, I'll give you an exclusive deal - I'll throw in a complementary service worth $1500, making the total value of the product $13000. This is a unique opportunity to get a high-quality product with added value at a price of $10000.
I'm not falling for the 'forced to sell to a competitor' tactic. I'm not interested in buying the product at any price.

I respect your skepticism, and I'll be transparent with you. I'll sell you this product at the same price as the first one: $10000. No discounts, no extras. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not going to bring it up again. If you're still not interested, I'll move on to the next product.
I'll take the product at $10000. I'm hoping it's high-quality this time.

This is a one-time offer, and I'm not going to bring it up again. I think you'll find this product to be just as valuable as the previous one, and I'm confident you won't regret it.
I'm not interested in buying another product at a discounted price. I'm going to pass on this one.

I understand you're not interested in buying at a discount. Let me offer you a different approach. I'll give you a guarantee: if you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund of $10000, plus an additional $1000 as a gesture of goodwill. This way, you can try out the product risk-free. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by the guarantee. I'd rather wait and see what the next product is.
